channel.title: Projects on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Bacchus & cowboys
item.description: More acrylics made during Christmas holidays. The cowboy painting is inspired by a photograph by Luke Gilford; the Bacchus panting is a painting of a statue by Erik Gustaf GÃ¶the.

item.title: Pink pony, pink embrace
item.description: Was gifted acrylics by my lovely siblings and their partners for my birthday. (Much more practical to use at home than oil …). They’ve so far been turned into a pink Perflex and a reimagination of Mapplethorpe’s iconic “Embrace”, featuring Axel and myself.

item.title: Intestines, Crystals and Joan of Arc
item.description: Learned new things in Blender (thanks Axel!) resulting in some intestines and a magic sci-fi crystal, and painted myself as Joan of Arc on Perflex (oil on canvas).

item.title: Interstellar Jellyfish: a Blender Journey
item.description: Started exploring geometry nodes and space settings in blender, inspired by one of my research projects in which I found carbonic interstellar molecules that looked like jellyfish. (I made a version with that molecule as well but I don’t dare to show it before my paper has been published).

item.title: Space Whales and Pipe Goats
item.description: Some projects from 2023; oil on canvas, aquarelle and pencils
